primary_deity.name: Lord Nageshwar
primary_deity.meaning: Lord of the Nagas (Divine Serpents), Master of Kundalini Energy

mythology.origin_story: When the demon Daruka terrorized innocent people and imprisoned the Shiva devotee Supriya along with others, Supriya's unwavering devotion called forth Lord Shiva. The Lord emerged from underground as a pillar of light, destroyed the demon, and agreed to remain as the Nageshwar Jyotirlinga to protect and bless all devotees.
mythology.cosmic_significance: Shiva as Nageshwar represents mastery over serpent energy—both the external serpents and the internal kundalini shakti. Worshipping here is believed to awaken spiritual energy and grant protection from all serpent-related afflictions and fears.

sacred_mantras.name: Nageshwar Dhyana Mantra
sacred_mantras.meaning: Salutations to the Lord of Serpents
sacred_mantras.benefit: Protection from serpent fears, relief from Kaal Sarpa Dosh, awakening of kundalini

sacred_mantras.name: Nag Gayatri Mantra
sacred_mantras.sanskrit: ॐ नवकुलाय विद्महे विषधराय धीमहि तन्नो सर्पः प्रचोदयात्
sacred_mantras.meaning: May we know the Lord of the Nine Cobras, may we meditate on the One who holds venom, may the Divine Serpent illuminate us.
sacred_mantras.benefit: Removes fear of serpents and grants protection
